intro: Seseli pauciradiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, aromatic scent. Seseli pauciradiatum is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
